meanings.definition: In a prone manner; lying face down.
meanings.sent1: She lay pronely on the grass, enjoying the warmth of the sun on her back.
meanings.sent2: He slept pronely on the bed, with his face buried in the pillow.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out pronely in front of the fireplace, looking quite content.
meanings.sent4: The fallen leaves lay pronely on the ground, forming a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird hopped pronely along the branch, unable to fly.

meanings.definition: In a position of lying flat or stretched out.
meanings.sent1: The pronely cat napped peacefully in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent2: The pronely figure on the painting seemed to blend into the background.
meanings.sent3: The pronely snake slithered across the path, surprising the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The pronely tree cast a long shadow over the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The pronely snow-covered landscape sparkled in the moonlight.
